message.content:
A 'patas' is a type of monkey that belongs to the Old World monkey family.
These primates have long and slender limbs, hence their name, which means "legs" in Spanish.
Their fur is usually reddish-brown or grey in color, and it is quite thick and coarse.
Patas monkeys have distinctive white moustaches, as well as a white stripe running down their nose.
Their faces are quite expressive, with large eyes and expressive brows that can convey a range of emotions.
Patas monkeys are found in sub-Saharan Africa, where they live in savannas and grasslands.
They are known for their impressive running abilities, as they can hit speeds of up to 35 miles per hour.
